pr_title: [DB TimeLock] 3B.1 - DB TimeLock Bugfixes and Preparation for MNPTLSIT

timeline.message: Some progress, still stuck on dbkvs creation path bug

timeline.bodyText: There is some code duplication here, but I don't know if we want to clean that up in this PR or at all.
timeline.author: sudiksha27

replies.bodyText: I think as mentioned in #5025 it does make sense to clean that up (e.g. move this to container test utils), just that I wouldn't prioritise it right now.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.author: sudiksha27

replies.bodyText:
This is overridden in DbTimestampCreator: when the service is shut down, it needs to gracefully close its connections to the key-value-service. Because of encapsulation we (rightly, IMO) don't expose the KVS above the ServiceDiscoveringDatabaseTimeLockSupplier.
Or do you mean why are we providing a default no-op impl? I don't mind changing that and having PaxosTimestampCreator explicitly say that it does nothing - fine either way.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: I meant the latter, apologies it was not clear; I thought it would be good to force overriding close() so it can not be ignored.
replies.author: sudiksha27

replies.bodyText: I agree with no default here
replies.author: gmaretic

replies.bodyText: Cool, added no-op close to PaxosTimestampCreator and removed the default impl. Makes sense
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.author: sudiksha27

replies.bodyText: Currently we don't. It's fair to remove it for now, so I will
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: Are we using the kvsConfig OR plan on using it? If so, It might be worth adding a comment otherwise, I am skeptical of passing around the config.
timeline.author: sudiksha27

replies.bodyText:
I was originally planning on using it (at some point we should implement support for this in db-timelock as well), though actually it probably won't be enough in that we should use the same KVS as the timestamp creator.
Will switch to a boolean for now, though this will change again soon.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.message: Merge branch 'jkong/test-rule-for-dbkvs' of github.com:palantir/atlasdb into jkong/test-rule-for-dbkvs

timeline.bodyText: Not in scope (?) but the inversion of parameters here and in atlasFactory.createRawKeyValueService is infuriating
timeline.author: gmaretic

replies.bodyText: Yeah, now's not a good time to touch this class's API (and above)
replies.author: jeremyk-91

+        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Loading all namespaces from the database is not supported yet!");

replies.bodyText: Yep! I probably should have given a bit more context. Internally this part of the workstream has two phases: 3B (which is ensuring db timelock runs single client namespace integration tests correctly) and 3C (which is giving full compatibility with MNPTLSIT, including the getAllNamespaces tests). Eventually in 3C.3 this will be implemented :)
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.author: gmaretic

replies.bodyText: Good call, yeah I copypasted this one
replies.author: jeremyk-91
